definition: too old/overage/(of a young person's behavior or attributes) beyond one's years/adultlike
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-

sentences.english: They are over age; they can't go half.
sentences.chinese: 他們超齡了，不能買半票。

definition: in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
ability to make one's own decisions
to talk from one's personal experience/to use oneself as an example
identity card/also written 身份證|身份证[shen1 fen4 zheng4]
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
a couple where both spouses are not Hong Kong citizens
the characteristics and circumstances particular to a country/current state of a country
